Authors: Putri N.K.S., Rahman A., Qing C.H.G., Djojo B.W.
Title: Knowledge management systems in construction consulting company
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rahman, A., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Djojo, B.W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As a construction consulting company, knowledge management is a crucial asset required to be competitively advantageous in the industry. It is not commonly practiced systematically, particularly in state owned companies. Hence, the purpose of this research is to develop a web-based knowledge management system design based on the path analysis results and TAM model to support state owned companies. The path analysis aims to determine the extent of the employee's intention to support knowledge management system creation. The data will be collected from 63 respondent questionnaire, interviews and observation in the construction consulting company. The research results revealed the significance between attitude toward computer and organizational culture toward the intentions of employees using knowledge management systems. Therefore, the knowledge management system design is recommended to apply in the company with the suggestive KMS features. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Knowledge management system; OOAD; Path analysis; State owned companies; TAM
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Human resource management; Knowledge based systems; Regression analysis; Surveys; Systems analysis; Consulting companies; Knowledge management system; Organizational cultures; Path analysis; Research results; State-owned companies; Support knowledge; Web based; Knowledge management

Authors: Sukarman H., Putri N.K.S., Qing C.H.G.
Title: Green information technology government regulation components: Improving Indonesia green information technology
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information and communication technology (ICT) becomes one of the key drivers of economic growth and competitiveness. In contrary, the increasing of the ICT usage is not followed by the increasing of the green ICT awareness and behavior. Our previous research on Private higher education institution practice of green information technology governance model had resulted some obstruction on the implementation. One of the most crucial aspect among others is the government policies and regulations deficiencies. Hence, this study describes as well as proposes green IT government regulation components which can be regulated by Indonesia’s government. 6(six) green IT government regulation components (green knowledge, regulatory design, regulation dimensions, directive cost, awareness and innovation/technology) were categorized based on literature review. © 2005 – ongoing JATIT & LLS
Author Keywords: Government Regulation); Green Computing; Green Information Technology; Green Information Technology Government

Authors: Putri N.K.S., Qing C.H.G., Kuncoro E.A., Goenadi E.
Title: Evaluation of Knowledge Management System Using House of Quality Method in Private Banking Industry
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Business Information Technology Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., Business Information Technology Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kuncoro, E.A., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Goenadi, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to describe the evaluation of knowledge management system (KMS) using House of Quality Method for several branches of private banking industry in Indonesia. The high-level house of quality matrix was modified and used as a tool to evaluate the ongoing KMS implementation. Additionally, the Infosys KM Maturity Model was applied to determine its maturity level. Targeted result for this study is to form a recommendation for KMS implementation in the organization, especially in the private banking industry. KMS spread to various business field. It becomes an obligation for every organization to manage its knowledge flow and drive it to achieve innovation. As an industry with huge amount of knowledge come in and out daily, banking industry need to take their KMS to another level. By evaluating its KMS periodically, organization may improve the performance, quality and maturity level of its KMS. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: HoQ; house of quality; KMS; knowledge management system; private banking industry

Title: Green Information Technology Policy in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukarman, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Based on prior research about green information technology governance model for private higher education institution, it was founded that the difficulties of green IT implementation, caused by lack of government policies and regulations. Although the Green IT Strategy model has been proposed and elaborated in terms of its starting point and the detail of activities, many of them are reluctant to implement it. Hence, this paper describes and proposes green IT policy that can be prepared and regulated by Indonesia's government. Basic model and advance model of green IT government model were recommended. Various laws and regulations on green IT topic were collected and categorized. Expectantly, it will inspires both government and institutions to implement the strategy. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Soeprapto Putri N.K., Steven Puika K., Ibrahim S., Darmawan L.
Title: Defect Classification Using Decision Tree
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Soeprapto Putri, N.K., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Steven Puika, K., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ibrahim, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Darmawan, L., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Product defect is any design fault, manufacturing failure or labeling matter which makes a product unsafe to use. It can be classified into several types, such as unacceptable dimensions, defects on the material, and others. However, due to the various factors that may cause the defect, it is not easy to pinpoint what actually causes the defect on the products. By using a decision tree, it is easier to determine the root cause of each defect as well as providing fast-response solution for each case. In the Quality Control (QC) department of a grinding wheel manufacturing company, the QC staffs need to answer some questions about the characteristics of the products. The decision tree certainly will help to find the root cause and it also generates the action for solving the problems. At the end of the session, the staff will get the decision whether the product can be accepted or should be destroyed. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Decision trees; Defects; Information management; Product design; Defect classification; Design faults; Fast response; Manufacturing companies; Product defects; Root cause; Quality control

Title: Knowledge management model for telemedicine
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hudiarto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Argogalih, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As a major issue not only in Indonesia, but also in the most countries around the world, healthcare has become the main topic of this paper. As a matter of fact, the use of information technology and information system for medical purpose is continuously growing. This phenomenon is widely known as telemedicine. Indonesia as the largest country in South East Asia has been facing healthcare as its key problem. The equal distribution of healthcare is difficult to achieve due to the geographical condition. Therefore, the need to implement knowledge management (KM) for telemedicine in Indonesia will help Indonesian society obtain medical knowledge simultaneously. The KM model for Telemedicine in Indonesia was derived from SECI model by Nonaka and Takeuchi. The conversion of 2(two) types of knowledge (tacit and explicit knowledge) were becoming the focus point. The research methodology used literature review and forum group discussion (FGD) with medical practitioners. Expectantly, most features created from this model, will become propose features for KM portal for telemedicine in Indonesia. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Knowledge Conversion; Knowledge Management; Knowledge Management Model; SECI Model; Spiral Model; Telemedicine

Title: Modeling Green balanced scorecard for private higher education institutions
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hudiarto, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Putri, N.K.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Argogalih, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to develop a balanced scorecard (BSC) for measuring green IT initiatives in the private higher education institution. The conception of the Green BSC was derived from Green IT Governance model for private higher education institution that already constructed from the prior research. The balanced score in the balanced scorecard provides a measurement for particular objectives set by the organization. However, in Green BSC, list of objectives were given to standardize the measurement for each private higher education institution. Institutions can calculate the balance score by themselves and implement the initiatives provide. Yet, further research may be applied to validate the propose model. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BSC; Green Balanced Scorecard; Green BSC; Green IT; Higher Education
Index Keywords: Green computing; Information management; Records management; Balanced scorecards; Green BSC; Higher education; Higher education institutions; Education

Title: The impact of downsizing on knowledge sharing in an airline company
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Companies are becoming more proactive towards changes in face of the turbulent environment. As the market becomes increasingly unpredictable, people are forced to develop their individual potentials for the sake of survival. Besides personal development, interaction among people through sharing of knowledge is equally critical. This paper discusses the impact of downsizing on knowledge sharing environment in an airline company. The findings reveal that employees had different views on the impact of downsizing on knowledge sharing. Their views were influenced by self-enthusiasm towards knowledge sharing. The availability of media for sharing also had an influence on knowledge sharing.
Author Keywords: Airline industry; Downsizing; Knowledge management; Knowledge sharing

Authors: Putri N.K.S., Arto H., Argog A., Joredjo H.
Title: E-waste handling in DKI Jakarta private higher education institution
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Arto, H., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Argog, A., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Joredjo, H., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The growth of electronically usage has given rise to a new environmental challenge, known as electronic waste. The negative impact that is caused from the waste of electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE), has forced many institutions to take some serious action. In the other hand the dependencies toward electronic devices are getting higher, especially in the education area. This paper discusses the E-Waste handling in the area of private higher education institution. Private higher education institution gives significantly contribution to the increasing of the electronic waste. The use of technology has grown rapidly caused by the growth of the student’s intake as well as the need to provide them with the latest technology. However, E-Waste model has been developed and still under reviewed continuously. © 2005 - 2015 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: E-Waste; Electronic waste; Green computing; Green IT

Authors: Putri N.K.S., Hudiarto, Argogalih, Muljoredjo H.
Title: The use of green information technology governance model to determine capability maturity level in DKI Jakarta private higher education institutions
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Concentration Content Coordinator, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hudiarto, Concentration Content Coordinator, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Argogalih, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Muljoredjo, H., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Defined as the use of eco-friendly system and information technology, green Information Technology (IT) has been adopted in most world class universities worldwide. Meanwhile, DKI Jakarta as the capital city of Indonesia has a total of 325 private higher education institutions. Green IT term is quiet well known in these areas, although its implementation is still sporadic. However, information technology (IT) gives fully support toward the learning process at the campus area. As its project scope, this research was focused in DKI Jakarta, but it is applicable for others. Many research on green IT or green computing have been conducted, however none of them focusing on Private Higher Education Institutions in Indonesia. Based on the previous research done by various Private Higher Education Institutions,IBM and Green Computing Methodology by GTYS, the Green IT Governance Model for Private Higher Education Institutions in DKI Jakarta area was developed. However, further researches are expected in order to develop the best practice. Furthermore, energy saving, waste management systems and information technology will be controlled accordingly and the threat of toxins that can harm our health can be avoided. © 2005 - 2014 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Green IT; Green IT model; Private higher education institution
